001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003/**
004 * A container class for various interfaces and implementing classes that affect continuous noise, such as that produced
005 * by {@link FastNoise} or {@link SeededNoise}, as well as static utility methods used throughout noise code.
006 * <br>
007 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 3/17/2017.
008 */
009public class Noise {
010    public static final SeededNoise alternate = new SeededNoise(0xFEEDCAFE);
011    /**
012     * Like {@link Math#floor}, but returns a long.
013     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
014     *
015     * @param t the double to find the floor for
016     * @return the floor of t, as a long
017     */
018    public static long longFloor(double t) {
019        return t >= 0.0 ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
020    }
021    /**
022     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns a long.
023     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
024     *
025     * @param t the double to find the floor for
026     * @return the floor of t, as a long
027     */
028    public static long longFloor(float t) {
029        return t >= 0f ? (long) t : (long) t - 1L;
030    }
031    /**
032     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)} , but returns an int.
033     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
034     * @param t the float to find the floor for
035     * @return the floor of t, as an int
036     */
037    public static int fastFloor(double t) {
038        return t >= 0.0 ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
039    }
040    /**
041     * Like {@link Math#floor(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
042     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
043     * @param t the float to find the floor for
044     * @return the floor of t, as an int
045     */
046    public static int fastFloor(float t) {
047        return t >= 0f ? (int) t : (int) t - 1;
048    }
049    /**
050     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but returns an int.
051     * Doesn't consider "weird doubles" like INFINITY and NaN.
052     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
053     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
054     */
055    public static int fastCeil(double t) {
056        return t >= 0.0 ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
057    }
058    /**
059     * Like {@link Math#ceil(double)}, but takes a float and returns an int.
060     * Doesn't consider "weird floats" like INFINITY and NaN.
061     * @param t the float to find the ceiling for
062     * @return the ceiling of t, as an int
063     */
064    public static int fastCeil(float t) {
065        return t >= 0f ? -(int) -t + 1: -(int)-t;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
070     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
071     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(double, double, double)}), but slower (and smoother) than
072     * {@link  #lerp(double, double, double)}.
073     * @param start a valid double
074     * @param end a valid double
075     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
076     * @return a double between start and end inclusive
077     */
078    public static double cerp(final double start, final double end, double a) {
079        return (1.0 - (a *= a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a))) * start + a * end;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Cubic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
084     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively. Somewhat faster than
085     * quintic interpolation ({@link #querp(float, float, float)}), but slower (and smoother) than
086     * {@link #lerp(float, float, float)}.
087     * @param start a valid float
088     * @param end a valid float
089     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
090     * @return a float between start and end inclusive
091     */
092    public static float cerp(final float start, final float end, float a) {
093        return (1f - (a *= a * (3f - 2f * a))) * start + a * end;
094    }
095    /*
096     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
097     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
098     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
099     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
100     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
101     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
102     */
103    public static double querp(final double start, final double end, double a){
104        return (1.0 - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6.0 - 15.0) + 10.0))) * start + a * end;
105    }
106    /*
107     * Quintic-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
108     * Will smoothly transition toward start or end as a approaches 0 or 1, respectively.
109     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
110     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
111     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
112     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
113     */
114    public static float querp(final float start, final float end, float a){
115        return (1f - (a *= a * a * (a * (a * 6f - 15f) + 10f))) * start + a * end;
116    }
117
118
119    /**
120     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid doubles), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
121     * @param start a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
122     * @param end a valid double, as in, not infinite or NaN
123     * @param a a double between 0 and 1 inclusive
124     * @return a double between x and y inclusive
125     */
126    public static double lerp(final double start, final double end, final double a) {
127        return (1.0 - a) * start + a * end;
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Linear-interpolates between start and end (valid floats), with a between 0 (yields start) and 1 (yields end).
132     * @param start a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
133     * @param end a valid float, as in, not infinite or NaN
134     * @param a a float between 0 and 1 inclusive
135     * @return a float between x and y inclusive
136     */
137    public static float lerp(final float start, final float end, final float a) {
138        return (1f - a) * start + a * end;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Given a float {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
143     * end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
144     * @param a a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive
145     * @return a float between 0.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
146     */
147    public static double emphasize(final double a)
148    {
149        return a * a * (3.0 - 2.0 * a);
150    }
151    /**
152     * Given a float {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a float that adjusts a to be closer to the
153     * end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
154     * <br>
155     * Used by {@link ClassicNoise} and {@link  JitterNoise} to increase the frequency of high and low results, which
156     * improves the behavior of {@link Ridged2D} and other Ridged noise when it uses those noise algorithms.
157     * @param a a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive
158     * @return a float between -1.0f and 1.0f inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
159     */
160    public static double emphasizeSigned(double a)
161    {         
162        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
163        return a * a * (6.0 - 4.0 * a) - 1.0;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Given a double {@code a} from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer to
168     * the end points of that range (if less than 0.5, it gets closer to 0.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
169     * @param a a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive
170     * @return a double between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
171     */
172    public static double extreme(final double a)
173    {
174        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 6 - 15) + 10);
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Given a double {@code a} from -1.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive), this gets a double that adjusts a to be much closer
179     * to the end points of that range (if less than 0, it gets closer to -1.0, otherwise it gets closer to 1.0).
180     * @param a a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive
181     * @return a double between -1.0 and 1.0 inclusive that is more likely to be near the extremes
182     */
183    public static double extremeSigned(double a)
184    {
185        a = a * 0.5 + 0.5;
186        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 12 - 30) + 20) - 1.0;
187    }
188
189    public interface Noise1D {
190        double getNoise(double x);
191        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed);
192    }
193
194    public interface Noise2D {
195        double getNoise(double x, double y);
196        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed);
197    }
198
199    public interface Noise3D {
200        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z);
201        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed);
202    }
203
204    public interface Noise4D {
205        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w);
206        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed);
207    }
208
209    public interface Noise5D {
210        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u);
211        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed);
212    }
213
214    public interface Noise6D {
215        double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v);
216        double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed);
217    }
218
219    public static class Layered1D implements Noise1D {
220        protected int octaves;
221        protected Noise1D basis;
222        public double frequency;
223        public double lacunarity;
224        public Layered1D() {
225            this(Basic1D.instance);
226        }
227
228        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis) {
229            this(basis, 2);
230        }
231
232        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
233            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
234        }
235        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
236            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
237        }
238        public Layered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
239            this.basis = basis;
240            this.frequency = frequency;
241            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
242            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
243        }
244
245
246        @Override
247        public double getNoise(double x) {
248            x *= frequency;
249            int s = 1;
250            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
251            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
252                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
253            }
254            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
255        }
256
257        @Override
258        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
259            x *= frequency;
260            int s = 1;
261            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
262            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
263                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
264            }
265            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
266        }
267    }
268
269    public static class Layered2D implements Noise2D {
270        protected int octaves;
271        protected Noise2D basis;
272        public double frequency;
273        public double lacunarity;
274        public Layered2D() {
275            this(SeededNoise.instance);
276        }
277
278        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis) {
279            this(basis, 2);
280        }
281
282        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves) {
283            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
284        }
285        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
286            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
287        }
288        public Layered2D(Noise2D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
289            this.basis = basis;
290            this.frequency = frequency;
291            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
292            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
293        }
294
295        @Override
296        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
297            x *= frequency;
298            y *= frequency;
299            int s = 1;
300            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
301            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
302                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
303            }
304            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
305        }
306
307        @Override
308        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
309            x *= frequency;
310            y *= frequency;
311            int s = 1;
312            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
313            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
314                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
315            }
316            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
317        }
318    }
319    public static class Layered3D implements Noise3D {
320        protected int octaves;
321        protected Noise3D basis;
322        public double frequency;
323        public double lacunarity;

325            this(SeededNoise.instance);
326        }

329            this(basis, 2);
330        }
331
332        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves) {
333            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
334        }
335        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
336            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
337        }
338        public Layered3D(Noise3D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
339            this.basis = basis;
340            this.frequency = frequency;
341            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
342            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
347            x *= frequency;
348            y *= frequency;
349            z *= frequency;
350            int s = 1;
351            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
352            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
353                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)) * s;
354            }
355            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
356        }
357
358        @Override
359        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
360            x *= frequency;
361            y *= frequency;
362            z *= frequency;
363            int s = 1;
364            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
365            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
366                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
367            }
368            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
369        }
370    }
371    public static class Layered4D implements Noise4D {
372        protected int octaves;
373        protected Noise4D basis;
374        public double frequency;
375        public double lacunarity;
376        public Layered4D() {
377            this(SeededNoise.instance);
378        }
379
380        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis) {
381            this(basis, 2);
382        }
383
384        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves) {
385            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
386        }
387        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
388            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
389        }
390        public Layered4D(Noise4D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
391            this.basis = basis;
392            this.frequency = frequency;
393            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
394            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
395        }
396
397        @Override
398        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
399            x *= frequency;
400            y *= frequency;
401            z *= frequency;
402            w *= frequency;
403            int s = 1;
404            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
405            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
406                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8), w * i_s + (o << 9)) * s;
407            }
408            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
409        }
410
411        @Override
412        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
413            x *= frequency;
414            y *= frequency;
415            z *= frequency;
416            w *= frequency;
417            int s = 1;
418            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
419            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
420                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s, w * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
421            }
422            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
423        }
424    }
425    public static class Layered5D implements Noise5D {
426        protected int octaves;
427        protected Noise5D basis;
428        public double frequency;
429        public double lacunarity;
430        public Layered5D() {
431            this(SeededNoise.instance);
432        }
433
434        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis) {
435            this(basis, 2);
436        }
437
438        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves) {
439            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
440        }
441        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
442            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
443        }
444        public Layered5D(Noise5D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
445            this.basis = basis;
446            this.frequency = frequency;
447            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
448            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
449        }
450
451        @Override
452        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u) {
453            x *= frequency;
454            y *= frequency;
455            z *= frequency;
456            w *= frequency;
457            u *= frequency;
458            int s = 1;
459            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
460            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
461                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
462                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10)) * s;
463            }
464            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
465        }
466
467        @Override
468        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, long seed) {
469            x *= frequency;
470            y *= frequency;
471            z *= frequency;
472            w *= frequency;
473            u *= frequency;
474            int s = 1;
475            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
476            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
477                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
478                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
479            }
480            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
481        }
482    }

484    public static class Layered6D implements Noise6D {
485        protected int octaves;
486        protected Noise6D basis;
487        public double frequency;
488        public double lacunarity;
489        public Layered6D() {
490            this(SeededNoise.instance);
491        }
492
493        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis) {
494            this(basis, 2);
495        }
496
497        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves) {
498            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
499        }
500        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
501            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
502        }
503        public Layered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
504            this.basis = basis;
505            this.frequency = frequency;
506            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
507            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
508        }
509
510        @Override
511        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
512            x *= frequency;
513            y *= frequency;
514            z *= frequency;
515            w *= frequency;
516            u *= frequency;
517            v *= frequency;
518            int s = 1;
519            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
520            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
521                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
522                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
523            }
524            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
525        }
526
527        @Override
528        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
529            x *= frequency;
530            y *= frequency;
531            z *= frequency;
532            w *= frequency;
533            u *= frequency;
534            v *= frequency;
535            int s = 1;
536            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
537            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
538                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
539                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
540            }
541            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
542        }
543    }
544
545    public static class Warped1D extends Layered1D {
546        public Warped1D() {
547            this(Basic1D.instance);
548        }
549
550        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis) {
551            this(basis, 2);
552        }
553
554        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
555            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
556        }
557        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
558            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
559        }
560        public Warped1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity) {
561            this.basis = basis;
562            this.frequency = frequency;
563            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
564            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
565        }
566
567
568        @Override
569        public double getNoise(double x) {
570            x *= frequency;
571            int s = 1;
572            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
573            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
574                n += (prev = basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6) + prev * 0.25)) * s;
575            }
576            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
577        }
578
579        @Override
580        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
581            x *= frequency;
582            int s = 1;
583            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity, prev = 0.0;
584            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
585                n += (prev = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + prev * 0.25, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L))) * s;
586            }
587            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
588        }
589    }

847    public static class InverseLayered1D implements Noise1D {
848        protected int octaves;
849        protected Noise1D basis;
850        public double frequency;
851        /**
852         * A multiplier that affects how much the frequency changes with each layer; the default is 0.5 .
853         */
854        public double lacunarity = 0.5;
855        public InverseLayered1D() {
856            this(Basic1D.instance);
857        }
858
859        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis) {
860            this(basis, 2);
861        }
862
863        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves) {
864            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
865        }
866        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
867            this.basis = basis;
868            this.frequency = frequency;
869            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
870        }
871        public InverseLayered1D(Noise1D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
872            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
873            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
874        }
875
876        @Override
877        public double getNoise(double x) {
878            x *= frequency;
879            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
880            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
881            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
882                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6)) * s;
883            }
884            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
885        }
886
887        @Override
888        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
889            x *= frequency;
890            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
891            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
892            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
893                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
894            }
895            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
896        }
897    }

1142            this(basis, octaves, 1.0);
1143        }
1144        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency) {
1145            this.basis = basis;
1146            this.frequency = frequency;
1147            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1148        }
1149        public InverseLayered6D(Noise6D basis, final int octaves, double frequency, double lacunarity){
1150            this(basis, octaves, frequency);
1151            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
1152        }
1153
1154        @Override
1155        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v) {
1156            x *= frequency;
1157            y *= frequency;
1158            z *= frequency;
1159            w *= frequency;
1160            u *= frequency;
1161            v *= frequency;
1162            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1163            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1164            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1165                n += basis.getNoise(x * (i_s *= lacunarity) + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)
1166                        , w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
1167            }
1168            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1169        }
1170
1171        @Override
1172        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {
1173            x *= frequency;
1174            y *= frequency;
1175            z *= frequency;
1176            w *= frequency;
1177            u *= frequency;
1178            v *= frequency;
1179            int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
1180            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / lacunarity;
1181            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
1182                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * (i_s *= lacunarity), y * i_s, z * i_s
1183                        , w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L)) * s;
1184            }
1185            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
1186        }
1187    }

1543    public static class Ridged1D implements Noise1D {
1544        protected int octaves;
1545        public double frequency;
1546        protected Noise1D basis;
1547
1548        public Ridged1D() {
1549            this(Basic1D.instance, 2, 1.25);
1550        }
1551
1552        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis) {
1553            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1554        }
1555
1556        public Ridged1D(Noise1D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1557            this.basis = basis;
1558            this.frequency = frequency;
1559            setOctaves(octaves);
1560        }
1561
1562        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1563        {
1564            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1565        }
1566
1567        @Override
1568        public double getNoise(double x) {
1569            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1570            x *= frequency;
1571            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1572                n = basis.getNoise(x + (i << 6));
1573                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1574                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1575                sum += n * exp;
1576                x *= 2.0;
1577            }
1578            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1579        }
1580
1581        @Override
1582        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
1583            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1584            x *= frequency;
1585            for (int i = 0; i < octaves; i++) {
1586                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1587                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1588                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1589                sum += n * exp;
1590                x *= 2.0;
1591            }
1592            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1593        }
1594    }

1633    public static class Ridged2D implements Noise2D {
1634        protected int octaves;
1635        public double frequency;
1636        protected Noise2D basis;
1637
1638        public Ridged2D() {
1639            this(SeededNoise.instance, 2, 1.25);
1640        }
1641
1642        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis) {
1643            this(basis, 2, 1.25);
1644        }
1645
1646        public Ridged2D(Noise2D basis, int octaves, double frequency) {
1647            this.basis = basis;
1648            this.frequency = frequency;
1649            setOctaves(octaves);
1650        }
1651
1652        public void setOctaves(int octaves)
1653        {
1654            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
1655        }
1656
1657        @Override
1658        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
1659            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1660            x *= frequency;
1661            y *= frequency;
1662            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
1663                n = basis.getNoise(x + (o << 6), y + (o << 7)); // n is between -1 and 1
1664                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);                          // n is now between 0 and 1
1665                correction += (exp *= 0.5);                     // exp goes to 1 here, correction too
1666                sum += n * exp;                                 // sum is between 0 and 1
1667                //x *= 2.0;                                       // exaggerate details for the next
1668                //y *= 2.0;                                       // octave, by zooming in
1669                final double x2 = + x * +1.2177771028694522 + y * -1.5887107017244124;
1670                final double y2 = + x * +1.5887107017244124 + y * +1.2177771028694522;
1671                final double o2 = o << 6;
1672                x = x2 + o2; y = y2 + o2;
1673
1674            }
1675            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;                // for 1 octave, this is between -1 and 1
1676        }
1677
1678        @Override
1679        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
1680            double sum = 0.0, n, exp = 2.0, correction = 0.0;
1681            x *= frequency;
1682            y *= frequency;
1683            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
1684                n = basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L));
1685                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1686                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1687                sum += n * exp;
1688                final double x2 = + x * +1.2177771028694522 + y * -1.5887107017244124;
1689                final double y2 = + x * +1.5887107017244124 + y * +1.2177771028694522;
1690                final double o2 = o << 6;
1691                x = x2 + o2; y = y2 + o2;
1692            }
1693            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1694        }
1695    }

1722        @Override

1725            x *= frequency;
1726            y *= frequency;
1727            z *= frequency;
1728            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; ++o) {
1729                n = basis.getNoise(x + (o << 6), y + (o << 7), z + (o << 8));
1730                n = 1.0 - Math.abs(n);
1731                correction += (exp *= 0.5);
1732                sum += n * exp;
1733                final double x2 = + x * +0.0455933781512065 + y * +1.3525830280287148 + z * -1.4748009351700182;
1734                final double y2 = + x * +0.4990618052029940 + y * +1.4206960424763455 + z * +1.3184441863413694;
1735                final double z2 = + x * +1.9360777567940484 + y * -0.3981021362528052 + z * -0.3051528925976716;
1736                final double o2 = o << 6;
1737                x = x2 + o2; y = y2 + o2; z = z2 + o2;
1738            }
1739            return sum * 2.0 / correction - 1.0;
1740        }

1985
1986    public static class Turbulent2D implements Noise2D {
1987        protected int octaves;
1988        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
1989        public double frequency;
1990        protected double correction;
1991
1992        public Turbulent2D() {
1993            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
1994        }
1995
1996        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
1997            this(basis, disturb, 1);
1998        }
1999
2000        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2001            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2002        }
2003        public Turbulent2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2004            this.basis = basis;
2005            this.frequency = frequency;
2006            disturbance = disturb;
2007            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2008            correction = 1.0 / ((1 << this.octaves) - 1.0);
2009        }
2010
2011        @Override
2012        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2013            x *= frequency;
2014            y *= frequency;
2015            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y);
2016            int s = 1;
2017            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2018            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2019                i_s *= 0.5;
2020                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7)) * s;
2021            }
2022            return n * correction;
2023        }
2024
2025        @Override
2026        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2027            x *= frequency;
2028            y *= frequency;
2029            x += disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed);
2030            int s = 1;
2031            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2032            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2033                i_s *= 0.5;
2034                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
2035            }
2036            return n * correction;
2037        }
2038    }
2039    public static class Turbulent3D implements Noise3D {
2040        protected int octaves;
2041        protected Noise3D basis, disturbance;
2042        public double frequency;
2043        protected double correction;
2044
2045        public Turbulent3D() {
2046            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2047        }
2048
2049        public Turbulent3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb) {
2050            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2051        }
2052
2053        public Turbulent3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb, final int octaves) {
2054            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2055        }
2056        public Turbulent3D(Noise3D basis, Noise3D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2057            this.basis = basis;
2058            this.frequency = frequency;
2059            disturbance = disturb;
2060            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2061            correction = 1.0 / ((1 << this.octaves) - 1.0);
2062        }
2063
2064        @Override
2065        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2066            x *= frequency;
2067            y *= frequency;
2068            z *= frequency;
2069            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y, z);
2070            int s = 1;
2071            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2072            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2073                i_s *= 0.5;
2074                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8)) * s;
2075            }
2076            return n * correction;
2077        }
2078
2079        @Override
2080        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2081            x *= frequency;
2082            y *= frequency;
2083            z *= frequency;
2084            x += disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, seed);
2085            int s = 1;
2086            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2087            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2088                i_s *= 0.5;
2089                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, z * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
2090            }
2091            return n * correction;
2092        }
2093    }

2102        }
2103
2104        public Turbulent4D(Noise4D basis, Noise4D disturb) {
2105            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2106        }
2107
2108
2109        public Turbulent4D(Noise4D basis, Noise4D disturb, final int octaves) {
2110            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2111        }
2112        public Turbulent4D(Noise4D basis, Noise4D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2113            this.basis = basis;
2114            this.frequency = frequency;
2115            disturbance = disturb;
2116            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2117            correction = 1.0 / ((1 << this.octaves) - 1.0);
2118        }
2119
2120        @Override
2121        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z, double w) {
2122            x *= frequency;
2123            y *= frequency;
2124            z *= frequency;
2125            w *= frequency;
2126            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y, z, w);
2127            int s = 1;
2128            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2129            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2130                i_s *= 0.5;
2131                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8), w * i_s + (o << 9)) * s;
2132            }
2133            return n * correction;
2134        }
2135
2136        @Override
2137        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, long seed) {
2138            x *= frequency;
2139            y *= frequency;
2140            z *= frequency;
2141            w *= frequency;
2142            x += disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, seed);
2143            int s = 1;
2144            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2145            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2146                i_s *= 0.5;
2147                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, z * i_s, w * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
2148            }
2149            return n * correction;
2150        }
2151    }

2178            y *= frequency;
2179            z *= frequency;
2180            w *= frequency;
2181            u *= frequency;
2182            v *= frequency;
2183            x += disturbance.getNoise(x, y, z, w, u, v);
2184            int s = 1;
2185            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;
2186            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
2187                i_s *= 0.5;
2188                n += basis.getNoise(x * i_s + (o << 6), y * i_s + (o << 7), z * i_s + (o << 8), w * i_s + (o << 9), u * i_s + (o << 10), v * i_s + (o << 11)) * s;
2189            }
2190            return n * correction;
2191        }

2194        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, double w, double u, double v, long seed) {

2198            w *= frequency;
2199            u *= frequency;
2200            v *= frequency;

2202            int s = 1;
2203            double n = 0.0, i_s = 2.0;

2205                i_s *= 0.5;
2206                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x * i_s, y * i_s, z * i_s, w * i_s, u * i_s, v * i_s, seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * s;
2207            }

2209        }

2212    public static class Viny2D implements Noise2D {
2213        protected int octaves;
2214        protected Noise2D basis, disturbance;
2215        public double frequency;
2216
2217        public Viny2D() {
2218            this(SeededNoise.instance, alternate, 1);
2219        }
2220
2221        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb) {
2222            this(basis, disturb, 1);
2223        }
2224
2225        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves) {
2226            this(basis, disturb, octaves, 1.0);
2227        }
2228        public Viny2D(Noise2D basis, Noise2D disturb, final int octaves, final double frequency) {
2229            this.basis = basis;
2230            this.frequency = frequency;
2231            disturbance = disturb;
2232            this.octaves = Math.max(1, Math.min(63, octaves));
2233        }
2234
2235        @Override
2236        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2237            x *= frequency;
2238            y *= frequency;
2239            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2240            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2241            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2242                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2243                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2244                n += basis.getNoise(xx, yy) * s + disturbance.getNoise(xx, yy) * (s >>= 1);
2245            }
2246            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2247        }
2248
2249        @Override
2250        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2251            x *= frequency;
2252            y *= frequency;
2253            int s = 2 << (octaves - 1);
2254            double n = 0.0, i_s = 1.0 / s, xx, yy;
2255            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++) {
2256                xx = x * (i_s *= 2.0) + (o << 6);
2257                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2258                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * s + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(xx, yy, seed) * (s >>= 1);
2259            }
2260            return n / ((3 << octaves) - 3.0);
2261        }
2262    }

2622            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2623                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2624                xx = x * (i_s *= 0.5) + (o << 6);
2625                yy = y * i_s + (o << 7);
2626                zz = z * i_s + (o << 8);
2627                ww = w * i_s + (o << 9);
2628                uu = u * i_s + (o << 10);
2629                vv = v * i_s + (o << 11);
2630                n += basis.getNoiseWithSeed(xx + disturbance.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, v, seed), yy, zz, ww, uu, vv, seed) * s;
2631            }
2632            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2633        }
2634    }
2635
2636
2637    public static class Exponential1D implements Noise1D {
2638        protected Noise1D basis;
2639        protected double sharpness, adjustment;
2640        public Exponential1D() {
2641            this(Basic1D.instance);
2642        }
2643
2644        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis) {
2645            this(basis, 0.125);
2646        }
2647        public Exponential1D(Noise1D basis, double sharpness) {
2648            this.basis = basis;
2649            this.sharpness = sharpness - fastFloor(sharpness) - 1.0;
2650            this.adjustment = 2.0 / Math.log1p(this.sharpness * 0.9999999999999999);
2651            this.sharpness *= 0.5;
2652        }
2653
2654
2655        @Override
2656        public double getNoise(double x) {
2657            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoise(x) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2658        }
2659
2660        @Override
2661        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
2662            return Math.log(1.0 + sharpness * (basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, seed) + 1.0)) * adjustment - 1.0;
2663        }
2664    }
2665

2691        }

2802    /**
2803     * Used to add an extra parameter to 3D noise, such as one based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2804     * Adding a sine wave as the {@link #w} value to a world made with 3D noise results in
2805     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/w55JXtX.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2806     */
2807    public static class Adapted3DFrom4D implements Noise3D {
2808        public Noise4D basis;
2809        public double w;
2810        public Adapted3DFrom4D() {
2811            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2812        }
2813
2814        public Adapted3DFrom4D(Noise4D basis) {
2815            this.basis = basis;
2816        }
2817
2818        public double getW() {
2819            return w;
2820        }
2821
2822        public void setW(double w) {
2823            this.w = w;
2824        }
2825
2826        @Override
2827        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2828            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w);
2829        }
2830
2831        @Override
2832        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2833            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, seed);
2834        }
2835    }
2836
2837    /**
2838     * Used to add extra parameters to 3D noise, such as those based on rotation, time, or some non-spatial component.
2839     * Using {@link #setExtras(double)} to set {@link #w} and {@link #u} in a world made with 3D noise results in
2840     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zN2OmWx.gif">something that looks like this</a>.
2841     */
2842    public static class Adapted3DFrom5D implements Noise3D {
2843        public Noise5D basis;
2844        public double w, u;
2845        public Adapted3DFrom5D() {
2846            this(ClassicNoise.instance);
2847        }
2848
2849        public Adapted3DFrom5D(Noise5D basis) {
2850            this.basis = basis;
2851        }
2852
2853        public double getW() {
2854            return w;
2855        }
2856
2857        public void setW(double w) {
2858            this.w = w;
2859        }
2860
2861        public double getU() {
2862            return u;
2863        }
2864
2865        public void setU(double u) {
2866            this.u = u;
2867        }
2868
2869        /**
2870         * This sets the two extra noise parameters given one parameter, theta, which is treated as looping over a
2871         * circle of different w and u values, with one cycle equal to a change of 1.0 in theta.
2872         * @param theta only the fractional part matters; used to set both w and u. Cycles if it goes past an integer.
2873         */
2874        public void setExtras(double theta) {
2875            w = NumberTools.cos_(theta);
2876            u = NumberTools.sin_(theta);
2877        }
2878
2879        @Override
2880        public double getNoise(double x, double y, double z) {
2881            return basis.getNoise(x, y, z, w, u);
2882        }
2883
2884        @Override
2885        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, double z, long seed) {
2886            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, z, w, u, seed);
2887        }
2888    }
2889    
2890    public static class Seamless2D implements Noise2D {
2891        public Noise4D basis;
2892        public double inverseWidth = 0x1p-8, inverseHeight = 0x1p-8;
2893        
2894        public Seamless2D() {
2895            basis = new FoamNoise();
2896        }
2897        public Seamless2D(Noise4D basis) {
2898            this.basis = basis;
2899        }
2900        public Seamless2D(Noise4D basis, double width, double height) {
2901            this.basis = basis;
2902            this.inverseWidth = 1.0 / Math.abs(width);
2903            this.inverseHeight = 1.0 / Math.abs(height);
2904        }
2905
2906        @Override
2907        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
2908            x *= inverseWidth;
2909            y *= inverseHeight;
2910            return basis.getNoise(NumberTools.cos_(x), NumberTools.sin_(x), NumberTools.cos_(y), NumberTools.sin_(y));
2911        }
2912
2913        @Override
2914        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
2915            x *= inverseWidth;
2916            y *= inverseHeight;
2917            return basis.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos_(x), NumberTools.sin_(x), NumberTools.cos_(y), NumberTools.sin_(y), seed);
2918        }
2919    }
2920
2921    /**
2922     * Produces a 2D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2923     * Uses (x,y) order. Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2924     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless2D(double[][], int, int)}, which re-uses the array.
2925     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the outer layer of arrays)
2926     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the inner arrays)
2927     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2928     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2929     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[width][height]}.
2930     */
2931    public static double[][] seamless2D(final int width, final int height, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2932        return seamless2D(new double[width][height], seed, octaves);
2933    }
2934
2935    /**
2936     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2937     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2938     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
2939     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2940     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2941     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2942     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2943     */
2944    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, final int seed, final int octaves) {
2945        return seamless2D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
2946    }
2947
2948    public static double total;
2949    /**
2950     * Fills the given 2D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
2951     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x or y axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
2952     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise. DOES NOT clear the values in fill, so if it already has non-zero
2953     * elements, the result will be different than if it had been cleared beforehand. That does allow you to utilize
2954     * this method to add multiple seamless noise values on top of each other, though that allows values to go above or
2955     * below the normal minimum and maximum (-1.0 to 1.0).
2956     * @param fill a 2D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[width][height]} or something similar
2957     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
2958     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
2959     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
2960     */
2961    public static double[][] seamless2D(final double[][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise4D generator) {
2962        final int height, width;
2963        if (fill == null || (width = fill.length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0].length) <= 0
2964                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
2965            return fill;
2966        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height;
2967        int s = 1 << (octaves - 1);
2968        total = 0.0;
2969        double p, q,
2970                ps, pc,
2971                qs, qc,
2972                i_s = 0.5 / s;
2973        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s >>= 1) {
2974            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
2975            i_s *= 2.0;
2976            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2977                p = x * i_w;
2978                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
2979                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
2980                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2981                    q = y * i_h;
2982                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
2983                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
2984                    fill[x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, seed) * s;
2985                }
2986            }
2987        }
2988        i_s = 1.0 / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
2989        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
2990            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
2991                total += (fill[x][y] *= i_s);
2992            }
2993        }
2994        return fill;
2995    }
2996
2997    /**
2998     * Produces a 3D array of noise with values from -1.0 to 1.0 that is seamless on all boundaries.
2999     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3000     * Because most games that would use this would use it for maps, and maps are often top-down, the returned 3D array
3001     * uses the order (z,x,y), which allows a 2D slice of x and y to be taken as an element from the top-level array.
3002     * If you need to call this very often, consider {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int)}, which re-uses the
3003     * array instead of re-generating it.
3004     * @param width the width of the array to produce (the length of the middle layer of arrays)
3005     * @param height the height of the array to produce (the length of the innermost arrays)
3006     * @param depth the depth of the array to produce (the length of the outermost layer of arrays)
3007     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3008     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3009     * @return a freshly-allocated seamless-bounded array, a {@code double[depth][width][height]}.
3010     */
3011    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final int depth, final int width, final int height, final long seed, final int octaves) {
3012        return seamless3D(new double[depth][width][height], seed, octaves);
3013    }
3014
3015    /**
3016     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
3017     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
3018     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3019     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
3020     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3021     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3022     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
3023     */
3024    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, final long seed, final int octaves) {
3025        return seamless3D(fill, seed, octaves, SeededNoise.instance);
3026    }
3027
3028    /**
3029     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
3030     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
3031     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3032     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
3033     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3034     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3035     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
3036     */
3037    public static double[][][] seamless3D(final double[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves, final Noise.Noise6D generator) {
3038        final int depth, height, width;
3039        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
3040                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
3041            return fill;
3042        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
3043        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
3044        total = 0.0;
3045        double p, q, r,
3046                ps, pc,
3047                qs, qc,
3048                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
3049        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
3050            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3051            i_s *= 2.0;
3052            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3053                p = x * i_w;
3054                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
3055                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
3056                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3057                    q = y * i_h;
3058                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3059                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3060                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3061                        r = z * i_d;
3062                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3063                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3064                        fill[z][x][y] += generator.getNoiseWithSeed(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3065                    }
3066                }
3067            }
3068        }
3069        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3070        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3071            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3072                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3073                    total += (fill[z][x][y] *= i_s);
3074                }
3075            }
3076        }
3077        return fill;
3078    }
3079
3080    /**
3081     * Fills the given 3D array (modifying it) with noise, using values from -1.0 to 1.0, that is seamless on all
3082     * boundaries. This overload doesn't care what you use for x, y, or z axes, it uses the exact size of fill fully.
3083     * Allows a seed to change the generated noise.
3084     * @param fill a 3D array of double; must be rectangular, so it's a good idea to create with {@code new double[depth][width][height]} or something similar
3085     * @param seed an int seed that affects the noise produced, with different seeds producing very different noise
3086     * @param octaves how many runs of differently sized and weighted noise generations to apply to the same area
3087     * @return {@code fill}, after assigning it with seamless-bounded noise
3088     */
3089    public static float[][][] seamless3D(final float[][][] fill, long seed, final int octaves) {
3090        final int depth, height, width;
3091        if(fill == null || (depth = fill.length) <= 0 || (width = fill[0].length) <= 0 || (height = fill[0][0].length) <= 0
3092                || octaves <= 0 || octaves >= 63)
3093            return fill;
3094        final double i_w = 6.283185307179586 / width, i_h = 6.283185307179586 / height, i_d = 6.283185307179586 / depth;
3095        int s = 1<<(octaves-1);
3096        double p, q, r,
3097                ps, pc,
3098                qs, qc,
3099                rs, rc, i_s = 0.5 / s;
3100        for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s>>=1) {
3101            seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3102            i_s *= 2.0;
3103            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3104                p = x * i_w;
3105                ps = NumberTools.sin(p) * i_s;
3106                pc = NumberTools.cos(p) * i_s;
3107                for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3108                    q = y * i_h;
3109                    qs = NumberTools.sin(q) * i_s;
3110                    qc = NumberTools.cos(q) * i_s;
3111                    for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3112                        r = z * i_d;
3113                        rs = NumberTools.sin(r) * i_s;
3114                        rc = NumberTools.cos(r) * i_s;
3115                        fill[z][x][y] += SeededNoise.noise(pc, ps, qc, qs, rc, rs, seed) * s;
3116                    }
3117                }
3118            }
3119        }
3120        i_s = 1.0 / ((1<<octaves) - 1.0);
3121        for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
3122            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
3123                for (int z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
3124                    fill[z][x][y] *= i_s;
3125                }
3126            }
3127        }
3128        return fill;
3129    }
3130
3131    /**
3132     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this produces 1D noise that "tiles" by repeating
3133     * its output every {@code sizeX} units that {@code x} increases or decreases by. This doesn't precalculate an
3134     * array, instead calculating just one value so that later calls with different x will tile seamlessly.
3135     * <br>
3136     * Internally, this just samples out of a circle from a source of 2D noise.
3137     * @param noise a Noise2D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3138     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3139     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3140     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3141     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3142     */
3143    public static double seamless1D(Noise2D noise, double x, double sizeX, long seed)
3144    {
3145        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3146        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), seed);
3147    }
3148
3149    /**
3150     * Like {@link #seamless2D(double[][], long, int, Noise4D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3151     * instead calculating just one 2D point so that later calls with different x or y will tile seamlessly.
3152     * @param noise a Noise4D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3153     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3154     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3155     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3156     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3157     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3158     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3159     */
3160    public static double seamless2D(Noise4D noise, double x, double y, double sizeX, double sizeY, long seed)
3161    {
3162        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3163        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3164        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3165                seed);
3166    }
3167
3168
3169    /**
3170     * Like {@link #seamless3D(double[][][], long, int, Noise6D)}, but this doesn't precalculate noise into an array,
3171     * instead calculating just one 3D point so that later calls with different x, y, or z will tile seamlessly.
3172     * @param noise a Noise6D implementation such as a {@link SeededNoise} or {@link FastNoise}
3173     * @param x the x-coordinate to sample
3174     * @param y the y-coordinate to sample
3175     * @param z the z-coordinate to sample
3176     * @param sizeX the range of x to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3177     * @param sizeY the range of y to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3178     * @param sizeZ the range of z to generate before repeating; must be greater than 0
3179     * @param seed the noise seed, as a long
3180     * @return continuous noise from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive 
3181     */
3182    public static double seamless3D(Noise6D noise, double x, double y, double z, double sizeX, double sizeY, double sizeZ, long seed)
3183    {
3184        x *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeX;
3185        y *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeY;
3186        z *= 6.283185307179586 / sizeZ;
3187        return noise.getNoiseWithSeed(NumberTools.cos(x), NumberTools.sin(x), NumberTools.cos(y), NumberTools.sin(y),
3188                NumberTools.cos(z), NumberTools.sin(z), seed);
3189    }

3191    /**
3192     * A very simple 1D noise implementation, because a full-blown Perlin or Simplex noise implementation is probably
3193     * overkill for 1D noise. This does produce smoothly sloping lines, like Simplex noise does for higher dimensions.
3194     * The shape of the line varies over time, but <a href="https://i.imgur.com/83R3WLN.png">can look like this</a>.
3195     * If you give this a seed with {@link #getNoiseWithSeed(double, long)} instead of using {@link #getNoise(double)},
3196     * it will use a small extra step to adjust the spacing of peaks and valleys based on the seed, so getNoiseWithSeed
3197     * is slower than getNoise. If you use any Noise classes like {@link Noise.Layered1D}, they should use a seed anyway
3198     * because different octaves won't have different enough shapes otherwise.
3199     */
3200    public static class Basic1D implements Noise1D
3201    {
3202        public static final Basic1D instance = new Basic1D();
3203        public double alter1, alter2, alter3, alter4;
3204        public long lastSeed;
3205        public Basic1D()
3206        {
3207            this(1L);
3208        }
3209        public Basic1D(long seed)
3210        {
3211            lastSeed = seed;
3212            alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3213            alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3214            alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3215            alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3216        }
3217        @Override
3218        public double getNoise(double x) {
3219            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3220                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3221                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3222                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3223        }
3224
3225        @Override
3226        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, long seed) {
3227            if(lastSeed != seed)
3228            {
3229                lastSeed = seed;
3230                alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54;
3231                alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53;
3232                alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53;
3233                alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3234            }
3235            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3236                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3237                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3238                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3239        }
3240        public static double cubicSway(double value)
3241        {
3242            long floor = (value >= 0.0 ? (long) value : (long) value - 1L);
3243            value -= floor;
3244            floor = (-(floor & 1L) | 1L);
3245            return value * value * (3.0 - 2.0 * value) * (floor << 1) - floor;
3246        }
3247
3248        public static double noise(double x, long seed) {
3249            final double
3250                    alter1 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-54, 
3251                    alter2 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 11111) >> 11) * 0x1p-53, 
3252                    alter3 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 22222) >> 11) * 0x1.8p-53, 
3253                    alter4 = (DiverRNG.determine(seed + 33333) >> 11) * 0x1p-52;
3254            return (cubicSway(x * alter1) * 0.4375f +
3255                    cubicSway(x * alter2) * 0.3125f +
3256                    cubicSway(x * alter3) * 0.1875f +
3257                    cubicSway(x * alter4) * 0.0625f);
3258        }
3259    }

3394
3395    /**
3396     * A hybrid between value and gradient noise that may be faster for 1D noise. Every integer value of x given to this
3397     * will produce a result of 0. This only hashes one coordinate per noise call, unlike most value noise that needs 2
3398     * hashes in 1D and many more in higher dimensions. Based on <a href="https://www.shadertoy.com/view/3sd3Rs">Inigo
3399     * Quilez' "Basic Noise"</a>.
3400     */
3401    public static class QuilezNoise implements Noise1D, Noise2D {
3402
3403        public long seed;
3404        public QuilezNoise() {
3405            this(0xB0BAFE77L);
3406        }
3407
3408        public QuilezNoise(long seed) {
3409            this.seed = seed;
3410        }
3411        @Override
3412        public double getNoise(double x) { 
3413            return getNoiseWithSeed(x, seed);
3414        }
3415//            xFloor = (xFloor ^ xFloor << 7 ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
3416//            xFloor = (xFloor ^ xFloor >>> 41 ^ xFloor >>> 23) * (xFloor ^ xFloor >> 25 | 1) >>> 32;
3417//            final double h = xFloor * 0x1p-28 - 4.0;
3418//            seed = (seed ^ xFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L; // XLCG, helps randomize upper bits
3419//            // this next 'h' part finishes randomizing (not amazing quality, but fast), uses only the upper bits,
3420//            // and reduces it to a double between -8.0 and almost 8.0.
3421//            final double h = ((seed ^ seed >>> 26) * (seed | 0xA529) >>> 32) * 0x1p-28 - 8.0;
3422
3423        @Override
3424        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, final long seed) {
3425            x += ((seed & 0xFFFFFFFFL) ^ (seed >>> 32)) * 0x1p-24; // offset x by between 0.0 and almost 256.0
3426            final long xFloor = x >= 0.0 ? (long) x : (long) x - 1L, // floor of x as a long
3427                    rise = 1L - ((x >= 0.0 ? (long) (x + x) : (long) (x + x) - 1L) & 2L); // either 1 or -1
3428            x -= xFloor;
3429            // and now we flip the switch from "magic" to "more magic..."
3430            // this directly sets the bits that describe a double. this might seem like it should be slow; it is not.
3431            // seed and xFloor are XORed to roughly mix them together; adding would work too probably.
3432            // the two huge longs don't really matter except for their last digits:
3433            // the one that uses ^ must end in 5 or D (both hex) 
3434            // the one that uses * must end in 3 or B (both hex)
3435            // and that makes this a valid "XLCG," a cousin of the commonly used LCG random number generator.
3436            // it improves the randomness in the upper bits more than the lower ones, where the upper bits will become
3437            // more significant decimal places in the resulting double.
3438            // we unsigned-right-shift by 12, which puts the random bits all in the double's mantissa (which is how far
3439            // it is between the previous power of two and next power of two, roughly).
3440            // we bitwise OR with 0x4030000000000000L, which is the exponent section for a double between 16.0 and 32.0.
3441            // we work our magic and convert the bits to double.
3442            // subtracting 24.0 takes the range to -4.0 to 12.0, where we want it (Quilez used this).
3443            final double h = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble((seed ^ xFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L >>> 12 | 
3444                      0x4040000000000000L) - 52.0;
3445//                    0x4030000000000000L) - 20.0;
3446            // Quilez' quartic curve; uses the "rise" calculated earlier to determine if this is on the rising or
3447            // the falling side. Uses that complicated "h" as the height of the peak or valley in the middle.
3448            x *= x - 1.0;
3449            return rise * x * (h * x - 1.0);
3450        }
3451
3452        @Override
3453        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
3454            return getNoiseWithSeed(x, y, seed);
3455        }
3456
3457        @Override
3458        public double getNoiseWithSeed(double x, double y, long seed) {
3459            double n = 0.0;
3460            for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
3461                seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
3462                double xEdit = x += (((seed & 0x55555555L) | (seed >>> 32 & 0xAAAAAAAAL))) * 0x1p-29 + 0.5698402909980532;
3463                double yEdit = y += (((seed & 0xAAAAAAAAL) | (seed >>> 32 & 0x55555555L))) * 0x1p-29 + 0.7548776662466927;
3464                final long
3465                        xFloor = xEdit >= 0.0 ? (long) xEdit : (long) xEdit - 1,
3466                        yFloor = yEdit >= 0.0 ? (long) yEdit : (long) yEdit - 1;
3467                xEdit -= xFloor;
3468                yEdit -= yFloor;
3469                xEdit *= (xEdit - 1.0);
3470                yEdit *= (yEdit - 1.0);
3471                final double m = (xEdit + yEdit) * 0.5;
3472                final double h = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(HastyPointHash.hashAll(xFloor, yFloor, seed) >>> 12 | 0x4040000000000000L) - 52.0;
3473//            final double i = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble((~seed + yFloor ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L >>> 12 | 0x4030000000000000L) - 24.0;
3474                n += (m * (h * m - 1.0));
3475            }
3476            return n * 0.25;
3477////                    cerp(
3478//                    0.5 * (
3479//                            (xRise * m * (h * m - 1.0)) +
3480//                            (yRise * m * (i * m - 1.0))
3481//                    );
3482//                            //, 0.5 + (y - x) * 0.5);
3483        }
3484
3485    }
3486
3487    /*
34882x2:
3489final double x2 = + x * +0.6088885514347261 + y * -0.7943553508622062;
3490final double y2 = + x * +0.7943553508622062 + y * +0.6088885514347261;
3491
34923x3:

3520    public static class LayeredSpiral2D implements Noise2D {

3531        }

3537            this(basis, octaves, frequency, 0.5);
3538        }

3541            this.frequency = frequency;

3543            this.lacunarity = lacunarity;
3544        }

3546        @Override
3547        public double getNoise(double x, double y) {
3548            x *= frequency;
3549            y *= frequency;
3550            int s = 1;
3551            double n = 0.0;
3552            for (int o = 0; o < octaves; o++, s <<= 1) {
3553                n += basis.getNoise(x, y) * s;
3554                final double x2 = + x * +0.6088885514347261 + y * -0.7943553508622062;
3555                final double y2 = + x * +0.7943553508622062 + y * +0.6088885514347261;
3556                x = x2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); y = y2 * lacunarity + (o<<6);
3557            }
3558            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
3559        }

3571                x = x2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); y = y2 * lacunarity + (o<<6);

3837                final double v2 = + x * +0.5606136879764017 + y * -0.5518123912290505 + z * +0.4997557173523122 + w * -0.3555852919481873 + u * +0.0731165180984564 + v * +0.0560452079067605;
3838                x = x2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); y = y2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); z = z2 * lacunarity + (o<<6);  w = w2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); u = u2 * lacunarity + (o<<6); v = v2 * lacunarity + (o<<6);
3839
3840            }
3841            return n / ((1 << octaves) - 1.0);
3842        }
3843    }
3844}
